Analyzer.Title: Add braces (when expression spans over multiple lines).
Analyzer.MessageFormat: Add braces to {0} (when expression spans over multiple lines).

Analyzer.Title: Add braces to if-else (when expression spans over multiple lines).

Sample.Before: if (condition) // [|Id|] WhenTrue( x, y); else WhenFalse( x, y);

Analyzer.Title: Use explicit type instead of 'var' (when the type is not obvious).
Use explicit type instead of 'var' (foreach variable).
Use 'var' instead of explicit type (when the type is obvious).
Use explicit type instead of 'var' (when the type is obvious).

Option.Title: Use implicitly typed array (when type is obvious).

Sample.Before: var items = new string[] { A, B };

Analyzer.Title: Use block body or expression body.

Option.Title: Convert expression body to block body when expression is multi-line.
Convert expression body to block body when declaration is multi-line.

Sample.Before: public string[] Foo( string a, string b, string c) => new string[] { a, b, c }; // [|Id|]

Option.Title: Convert expression body to block body.

Analyzer.Title: [deprecated] Avoid multiline expression body.
Analyzer.Summary: This analyzer has been deprecated. Use EditorConfig option `roslynator.prefer_block_body_when_expression_spans_over_multiple_lines = true` instead.

Analyzer.Title: Convert lambda expression body to expression body.

Sample.Before: string Foo { get { return _foo; } set { _foo = value; } }

Analyzer.Title: Add new line before enum member.
Add new line before embedded statement.
Add new line after switch label.
Format binary operator on next line.
Add empty line after embedded statement.

Option.Title: Remove empty line between closing brace and switch section.

Analyzer.Title: Remove 'partial' modifier from type with a single part.
Remove original exception from throw statement.
Rename private field to camel case with underscore.

Option.Title: Do not rename private static field to camel case with underscore.

Analyzer.Title: Asynchronous method name should end with 'Async'.
Analyzer.MessageFormat: Add suffix 'Async' to asynchronous method name.

Analyzer.Title: Non-asynchronous method name should not end with 'Async'.
Analyzer.MessageFormat: Remove suffix 'Async' from non-asynchronous method name.

Analyzer.Title: Use lambda expression instead of anonymous method.
Include/omit parentheses when creating new object.

Option.Title: Remove parentheses when creating new object.

Analyzer.Title: Add/remove parentheses from condition in conditional operator.

Option.Title: Remove parentheses from condition of conditional expression (when condition is a single token).
Option.MessageFormat: Remove parentheses from condition of conditional expression.

Analyzer.Title: Replace foreach statement with for statement.
Merge local declaration with return statement.
Avoid semicolon at the end of declaration.
Analyzer.MessageFormat: Remove semicolon from the end of declaration.

Analyzer.Title: Avoid usage of using alias directive.
Add empty line between declarations.
Analyzer.Remarks: This analyzer does not enforce an empty line between two single-line declaration.

Analyzer.Title: Avoid locking on publicly accessible instance.
Analyzer.MessageFormat: Lock on private field instead of locking on '{0}'.

Analyzer.Title: Declare each type in separate file.
Avoid interpolated string with no interpolation.
Analyzer.MessageFormat: Remove '$' from interpolated string with no interpolation.

Analyzer.Title: Avoid usage of do statement to create an infinite loop.
Analyzer.MessageFormat: Use while statement to create an infinite loop.

Analyzer.Title: Avoid usage of for statement to create an infinite loop.
Analyzer.MessageFormat: Use while statement to create an infinite loop.

Analyzer.Title: Avoid usage of while statement to create an infinite loop.
Analyzer.MessageFormat: Use for statement to create an infinite loop.

Analyzer.Title: Remove argument list from object creation expression.
Avoid empty catch clause that catches System.Exception.

Sample.Before: IEnumerable<Foo> x = items.Where(f => f is Foo).Cast<Foo>();

Analyzer.Title: Throwing of new NotImplementedException.
Analyzer.MessageFormat: Implement the functionality instead of throwing new NotImplementedException.

Sample.After: private string s; private string s2;

Analyzer.Title: Use coalesce expression instead of conditional expression.
Use carriage return + linefeed as new line.
Add empty line before 'while' keyword in 'do' statement.
Declare using directive on top level.
Constant values should be placed on right side of comparisons.
Default label should be the last label in a switch section.
Analyzer.MessageFormat: Move default label to the last position in a switch section.

Analyzer.Title: Format documentation summary on a single line.
Format documentation summary on multiple lines.

Option.Title: Do not simplify conditional expression when condition is inverted.

Analyzer.Title: Add 'static' modifier to all partial class declarations.
Add braces to switch section with multiple statements.
Replace yield/return statement with expression statement.
Add break statement to switch section.
Add return statement that returns default value.

Sample.After: const string s = "a"; string s2 = s + "b";

Analyzer.Title: Bitwise operation on enum without Flags attribute.
Declare enum member with zero value (when enum has FlagsAttribute).

Sample.After: [Flags] public enum Foo { None = 0, A = 1, B = 2 }

Analyzer.Title: Merge switch sections with equivalent content.
Add documentation comment to publicly visible type or member.
Add summary element to documentation comment.

Sample.Before:
string s = null;
string s2 = s as string; // [|Id|]

Analyzer.Title: Member type must match overridden member type.
Add empty line after closing brace.

Sample.Before: public enum Foo // [|Id|] { D = 4, B = 2, A = 1, C = 3 }
Sample.After: public enum Foo { A = 1, B = 2, C = 3, D = 4 }

Analyzer.Title: Use string.Length instead of comparison with empty string.

Link.Text: CA1820: Test for empty strings using string length

Analyzer.Title: Composite enum value contains undefined flag.
Analyzer.MessageFormat: Composite enum value contains undefined flag {0}.

Sample.Before: [Flags] public enum Foo { None = 0, A = 1, B = 2, C = 4, D = 8, X = 17 // [|Id|] }

Analyzer.Title: Static member in generic type should use a type parameter.
Abstract type should not have public constructors.
Unused parameter.
Analyzer.Remarks:
This analyzer does not provide a code fix. Use built-in "Change signature.." dialog to remove a parameter.
Unused parameter is not reported when its name consists of underscore(s).

Analyzer.Title: Unconstrained type parameter checked for null.
Value type object is never equal to null.
Overriding member cannot change access modifiers.
Parameter name differs from base name.
Analyzer.MessageFormat: Parameter name '{0}' differs from base name '{1}'.

Sample.Before: public object Foo { get; private set; }

Analyzer.Title: Use 'var' instead of explicit type (when the type is not obvious).
Use 'var' instead of explicit type (in foreach).

Sample.Before: public string Value { get; } // Gets a value.

Analyzer.Title: Format initializer with single expression on single line.
Format conditional expression (format ? and : on next line).
Use Regex instance instead of static method.

Sample.Before: public string Foo { get; set; } = null;

Analyzer.Title: Declare enum value as combination of names.

Sample.Before: [Flags] public enum Foo { None = 0, A = 1, B = 2, C = 4, ABC = 7 // [|Id|] }
Sample.After: [Flags] public enum Foo { None = 0, A = 1, B = 2, C = 4, ABC = A | B | C }

Analyzer.Title: Unnecessary usage of verbatim string literal.
Overriding member should not change 'params' modifier.
Call extension method as instance method.
Avoid unnecessary boxing of value type.
Order named arguments according to the order of parameters.
Use conditional access instead of conditional expression.
Use anonymous function or method group.

Option.Title: Convert method group to anonymous function.

Analyzer.Title: Return completed task instead of returning null.
Expression is always equal to true/false.
Use pattern matching instead of combination of 'is' operator and cast operator.
Use pattern matching instead of combination of 'as' operator and null check.

Sample.Before: #pragma warning disable CS0000 #pragma warning disable CS0001

Analyzer.Title: Mark publicly visible type with DebuggerDisplay attribute.
Make method an extension method.
Analyzer.Summary: Public/internal method in public/internal static class whose name ends with "Extensions" should be an extension method.

Analyzer.Title: Make class sealed.
Analyzer.Summary: A class that has only private constructors should be marked as sealed.

Analyzer.Title: Validate arguments correctly.
Analyzer.Summary:
An iterator method (a method that contains `yield`) will not validate arguments until the caller begins to enumerate the result items.
To ensure that arguments are validated immediately (when the method is called), move the iterator to a separate method (local function).

Link.Text: The curious case of async, await, and IDisposable

Analyzer.Title: Use exception filter.
Analyzer.Remarks:
The accepted [answer](https://stackoverflow.com/a/28879616) from Stack Overflow states: >"If there is an exception thrown within the filter, then that exception will be silently swallowed and the filter simply fails."
It is impossible to definitely detect if an exception can be thrown within an expression.
So the expression is considered as the one that can throw an exception if it contains method call that meets one of the following requirements:
* Its name starts with `ThrowIf`. * Its XML comment contains `<exception>` element.

Link.Text: What's New in C# 6.0 - Exception Filters
Exception filters in C# 6: their biggest advantage is not what you think

Sample.Before: [Flags] enum Foo // [|Id|] { None = 0, Alpha = 1, Beta = 2, Gamma = 4, }
Sample.After: [Flags] enum Foo { None = 0, Alpha = 1, Beta = 1 << 1, Gamma = 1 << 2, }

Analyzer.Title: Implement non-generic counterpart.
Analyzer.Summary: Publicly visible type that implements `IComparable<T>`, `IComparer<T>` or `IEqualityComparer<T>` should implement their non-generic counterpart.

Analyzer.Title: Do not pass non-read-only struct by read-only reference.

Link.Text: The 'in'-modifier and the readonly structs in C#

Analyzer.Title: Simplify 'default' expression.
Analyzer.Summary: This analyzer is similar to [IDE0034](https://docs.microsoft.com/visualstudio/ide/common-quick-actions#remove-type-from-default-value-expression) but there are some differences. For example this analyzer does not simplify 'default' expression passed as an argument expression.

Option.Title: Do not use element access when expression is invocation.

Link.Text: Recommended tags for documentation comments (C# programming guide)

Option.Title: Use comparison instead of pattern matching to check for null.
